ideas.title: Ex-Splunk execs’ startup Resolve AI hits $1 billion valuation with Series A
ideas.description: The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners, according to people familiar with the deal.
hooks: How Top Startups Hit $1B Without Traditional VC
Startup Funding Secrets: AI Valuation Masterclass
Build a $1B Startup: The AI Playbook Revealed

tips: Use screen recording to break down funding strategies
Include founder interview clips for credibility
Create chapter markers for key funding milestones

visualDirection.description: Bold, tech-forward design with futuristic blue and silver color palette. Dynamic motion graphics showing funding growth. Clean, sans-serif typography with data visualization overlays. Geometric transitions between sections. Minimal but high-contrast design that feels cutting-edge and authoritative.

exampleOutline: Section 1: Hook - Resolve AI's Unexpected Journey
Section 2: Context - Enterprise AI Funding Landscape
Section 3: Step-by-Step Valuation Strategy Breakdown
Section 4: Key Insights from Ex-Splunk Executives
Section 5: How Viewers Can Apply These Lessons

ideas.title: Cursor continues acquisition spree with Graphite deal
ideas.description: Graphite is an AI code review assistant that was last valued at $290 million.
hooks: AI's Secret Weapon: Inside Cursor's Bold Acquisition
How One Startup Is Reshaping Developer Tools

tips: Use archival/interview footage mixed with code screen recordings
Include dynamic motion graphics explaining technical acquisition details
Create chapter markers highlighting key narrative moments

visualDirection.description: Dark tech palette with electric blue/charcoal accents. Sleek modern typography with technical wireframe overlays. Cinematic documentary style with data visualization transitions. Blend of interview-style talking heads and dynamic screen capture sequences. Inspired by HBO tech documentaries with a cutting-edge design aesthetic.

exampleOutline: Cold Open: Dramatic acquisition announcement teaser
Origins of Graphite: Startup Journey Context
Technical Deep Dive: What Makes Graphite Unique
Industry Impact: Future of AI Code Review
Closing: Cursor's Strategic Vision CTA

ideas.title: Yann LeCun confirms his new ‘world model’ startup, reportedly seeks $5B+ valuation
ideas.description: Renowned AI scientist Yann LeCun confirmed on Thursday the worst-kept secret in the tech world: that he had indeed launched a new startup. Although he did say he will not be running the new company as its CEO.
hooks: Yann LeCun's $5B Startup: The AI World Model Revolution
Inside Tech's Biggest Secret: LeCun's Groundbreaking AI Venture
AI Pioneer's Bold $5B Bet: What Nobody's Telling You

tips: Use dynamic screen recordings of startup news/interviews
Include picture-in-picture of Yann LeCun talking
Create animated graphics explaining 'world model' concept
Use chapter markers to break down complex information
Include B-roll of AI research environments

visualDirection.description: High-contrast tech-futuristic palette (deep blues, electric teals, crisp whites). Dynamic motion graphics with transparent overlays. Modern sans-serif typography with technical precision. Animated data visualization elements. Sleek, cutting-edge aesthetic that feels both authoritative and innovative.

exampleOutline: Hook: Dramatic reveal of LeCun's startup story (30s)
Context: AI landscape and LeCun's background (2min)
Core Content: World Model startup details (3-4min)
Technical Deep Dive: Implications of $5B valuation (2min)
CTA: Invite viewers to join AI discussion community (30s)

ideas.title: Hardware’s brutal week: iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power go bankrupt
ideas.description: The hardware world had a brutal week, with iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes all filing for bankruptcy.  Each company faces its own mix of tariff pressures, supply chain issues, and shifting markets, but together they tell a larger story about the challenges of building physical products in an era of global trade tensions and […]
hooks: How Hardware Startups Survive Market Apocalypse
Startup Survival: Lessons from Tech Bankruptcies

tips: Use split-screen comparisons of failed/successful hardware companies
Include annotated financial charts and timeline graphics
Create chapter markers for each bankruptcy case study

visualDirection.description: High-contrast red/gray color palette signaling urgency. Dynamic infographic-style motion graphics. Bold, sans-serif typography with technical precision. Incorporate circuit board/tech blueprint textures. Use animated data visualizations showing financial decline. Picture-in-picture interviews/commentary. Technical but accessible visual language.

exampleOutline: Introduction: Hardware's Brutal Market Reality
Case Study 1: iRobot's Strategic Collapse
Case Study 2: Luminar's Market Challenges
Case Study 3: Rad Power's Scaling Struggles
Key Survival Strategies for Hardware Startups

ideas.title: OpenAI adds new teen safety rules to ChatGPT as lawmakers weigh AI standards for minors
ideas.description: OpenAI updated its guidelines for how its AI models should behave with users under 18, and published new AI literacy resources for teens and parents. Still, questions remain about how well policies translate into practice.
hooks: AI Safety Revolution: What Parents Need to Know Now
Teens + AI: The Shocking New Guidelines Explained
OpenAI's Teen Protection: Inside the Latest Rules

tips: Enable live chat for real-time audience interaction
Prepare pre-screened audience questions in advance
Use stream annotations to highlight key points dynamically

visualDirection.description: High-contrast digital interface aesthetic with tech-forward color palette (deep blues, electric teals, crisp whites). Dynamic motion graphics showing AI/teen interaction silhouettes. Clean, modern typography with technical overlay elements. Animated data visualizations highlighting safety metrics. Picture-in-picture design allowing simultaneous expert commentary and visual information.

exampleOutline: Live Stream Intro: Breaking Down OpenAI's New Teen Protocols
Contextualizing AI Risk: Current Landscape for Minors
Detailed Walkthrough of New Safety Guidelines
Expert Analysis: What These Rules Really Mean
Interactive Q&A Session with Audience
